title: Obama announces actions on immigration: 'What Iâm describing is accountability' â live | US news | The Guardian
summary: full text of obama immigration address .
boehner : obama has 'cemented legacy of lawlessness '
obama outlines 3 areas of action on immigration .
olc opinion : anticipated obama actions are 'permissible exercises '

text: we 're going to wrap up our live blog coverage for the evening .
we 'll resume tomorrow with further reaction to the speech and with coverage of the president 's rally in las vegas .

here 's a summary of where things stand : president barack obama announced the extension of protections against deportation for approximately 5m undocumented migrants in the united states , many of whom would become eligible for work permits but who would not receive green cards or citizenship .
the measure encompassed migrant parents of children who are citizens or legal residents , as well as an expanded pool of migrants who arrived in the united states as children .
obama billed the actions as a step toward accountability .
he said hundreds of border agents had been added in the southwest and that the new orders would clear backlogs in immigration courts .
the actions included a program to prioritize deportation of known criminals , individuals believed to pose a national security threat and others .
while hillary clinton and other democrats welcomed the actions , republicans decried the moves as a gross usurpation of power on the part of the president .
house speaker john boehner said obama was acting like an emperor and had cemented his legacy of lawlessness .
incoming senate majority leader mitch mcconnell said congress would take action to block the president .
obama described the actions as proceeding from a precedent established by presidents going back to eisenhower .
an opinion by the white house office of legal counsel was released backing the executive .

we should mention that tomorrow president barack obama is headed to las vegas for a rally at del sol high school , where he 's scheduled to give a speech and meet with students , including astrid silva , whose story he told tonight .
guardian washington correspondent paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) explains why del sol : las vegas is a symbolic place for the president to talk about immigration .
del sol high school was also the location the white house selected for a major speech obama gave in january 2013 urging comprehensive immigration reform .
nevada is also the state with the largest share of undocumented residents 7.6 % , according to research by pew , compared with 6.3 % in both california and texas .
undocumented migrants comprise 10.2 % of nevada 's labour population , the only state in the country where their share of the working population reaches double digits .

and nevada is the home state of the outgoing democratic senate majority leader , harry reid , who in recent days has been urging obama to do everything within his power to improve the immigration system .
i think when the president decides to do his executive order , he should go big , reid told reporters at a press conference on tuesday .
as big as he can .
guardian washington bureau chief dan roberts ( @ robertsdan ) sends this video , taken at a speech watching party in virginia that is the subject of this earlier post .
some undocumented migrants at the party left with the promise of new protections against deportation while others did not :
twitter has produced an animated chart showing the number of times the president 's speech was mentioned on twitter .
it looks like he peaked about a third of the way through at 9,594 tweets a minute .

judging by the reaction our correspondent rory carroll and others witnessed , that would probably be the pass a bill line : and to those members of congress who question my authority to make our immigration system work better , or question the wisdom of me acting where congress has failed , i have one answer : pass a bill
here 's a perspective you do n't see every day , via official white house photographer pete souza .
those lights seem like they 'd be kind of distracting : petesouza ( @ petesouza ) instagram of president obama in the east room where he will deliver his address to the nation on immigration at 8pm .

from the comments : jdanforth 21 november 2014 2:15am george w. bush deported more people than any previous president , but obama has already broken his record even though he still has two years left in the white house .
immigrants should be extremely skeptical of any immigration `` reform '' decreed by this man .
what do you think ?
is obama putting together a respectable record on immigration ?
univision has now reverted to the latin grammy awards broadcast , which was postponed on account of the president 's speech .
apparently no major categories have yet been awarded .
earlier we looked at the nominees for record of the year .

here now are the nominees for album of the year : 3.0 , by marc anthony ; tangos , by rubã©n blades ; multiviral , by calle 13 ; elypse , by camila ; cancin andaluza , by paco de lucã­a ; raã­z , by lila downs , niã±a pastori and soledad ; bailar en la cueva , by jorge drexler ; fonseca sinfnico by fonseca ; somos , by jarabe de palo ; and mã¡s + corazn profundo , by carlos vives .
who should win ?
tell us in the comments !
here 's the video for multiviral by calle 13 , featuring a voiceover by none other than julian assange :
hillary clinton thanks the president for his executive actions on immigration .
hillary clinton ( @ hillaryclinton ) thanks to potus for taking action on immigration in the face of inaction .
now let 's turn to permanent bipartisan reform .
# immigrationaction will the next democratic presidential nominee , whoever she may be , manage to take 70 % of the hispanic and latino vote , as obama did in 2012 ?
just idly wondering .
update : here 's a full statement from clinton ( h/t @ twitterid ) .
clinton says congress is guilty of an abdication of responsibility but only congress can finish the job .
abc news politics ( @ abcpolitics ) hillary clinton on immigration executive action : `` i support the president 's decision '' - @ twitterid kreutz

documents.title: full text of obama immigration address
text: the full text of obama 's address this evening now lives on our web site here .

we 're going to bring you now a scene that guardian washington bureau chief dan roberts ( @ robertsdan ) has witnessed in the andrade house in arlington , virginia , where family and friends gathered to watch the president 's speech .
some family members present were undocumented migrants .
some are eligible to receive protection from deportation under the new actions announced tonight .
some are not .
the vaca and andrade families watching the president 's speech together at the andrade house in arlington , virginia .
garcia betty andrade is one of the lucky ones , dan writes : as the mother of an us-born daughter , this 46 year-old nanny from arlington , virginia is eligible for relief under obama 's plan .
she knows she wo n't have to relive the nightmare that hit her family last year when her husband mario was pulled over for a drink-driving offence .
he faced deportation back to bolivia until a local campaign brought a temporary suspension to proceedings last year .

but the president 's action brings more permanent security and crucially the chance for betty and mario , who trained as an architect but instead works illegally in construction , to gain work permits .
betty andrade , her younger daughter claudia , roxana montano and ingrid vaca ( right ) .
garcia i feel a big relief , says betty .
i have always lived in fear .
i used to rarely leave the house .
it also gives her a chance to rekindle her career as an accountant which she was forced to drop when she left bolivia a decade ago .
we have dreams too , she says .
i hope to do a conversion course to build on the volunteer bookkeeping i have been doing at our local church .
but first i want to see my father in la paz who have i have n't seen in 10 years .
also in the room , but uncovered by tonight 's actions , was ingrid vaca .

i am very happy for my friends but this is not fair , says ingrid vaca , choking back tears after watching president obama 's speech sitting next to neighbours whose lives who have been transformed by his words : ingrid vaca being comforted by friends after watching the president 's speech .
garcia a single mother , who works in washington dc cleaning up to three houses a day alone , vaca is one of the six million undocumented immigrants who wo n't benefit from the executive action .

although her two bolivian-born sons , gustavo and diego , had their lives transformed by obama 's deferred action for childhood arrivals ( daca ) scheme in 2012 , their mother can not benefit from similar protection from deportation because she is not the parent of a citizen or green card holder .
she must continue to fear being pulled over by police , or go back to carrying her vacuum cleaner from house to house in a rucksack .
we are coming out from the shadows , but we do n't want to go back there , said vaca .
we want to see the light .
ingrid vaca .
garcia
the nyt archives twitter just happens to unearth a story about immigration reform from 1986 , in which a president and a congress got past their differences to pass landmark immigration reform .
and lived happily ever after : nyt archives ( @ nytarchives ) a divided congress and pres .
reagan passed landmark immigration reform 28 years ago this month ( h/t @ twitterid )

documents.title: boehner : obama has 'cemented legacy of lawlessness '
text: house speaker john boehner expands on his earlier comments , in which he said obama was acting like an emperor and a king .
that is not how american democracy works , boehner says .
by ignoring the will of the american people , president obama has cemented his legacy of lawlessness and squandered what little credibility he had left .
washington post ( @ washingtonpost ) boehner : `` president obama has cemented his legacy of lawlessness and squandered what little credibility he had left . ''
rep. steve king of iowa is on cnn saying obama has torn article 1 out of the constitution .
he 's a consistent critic of the white house on this and every other issue .
king says only two or three of us are here in washington .
most everyone in congress is home for the holiday .
glenn thrush ( @ glennthrush ) why does @ twitterid give 10 minutes to steve king , who is not a leader of the gop , and is n't especially well regarded in his own party ?
maybe because he was only one in town ?
the guardian 's social media editor kayla epstein ( @ kaylaepstein ) , to which this blog owes much , contributes another block .

shonda rhimes ' show grey 's anatomy might be going up against obama 's speech ( and in abc 's eyes , winning ) but she made a point to draw her followers to the president 's speech tonight , kayla writes : rhimes juggles multiple tv shows , so she was more than capable of live tweeting both grey 's and obama 's address at the same time .
shonda rhimes ( @ shondarhimes ) okay .
you know this goes .
west coast : get off twitter ! !
go watch obama on pbs .
i will see you at 8 pm pst .
east coast ?
let 's do this shonda rhimes ( @ shondarhimes ) obama : `` we are and always will be a nation of immigrants .
we were strangers once , too . ''
truth !
@ twitterid # tgit # greysanatomypotuslivetweet
immigration activist jose antonio vargas , who is 33 , was left out of the round of daca deferrals the president announced in 2012 , which set an age limit of 31 .
tonight that age limit has been removed .
jose antonio vargas ( @ joseiswriting ) i can now have temporary status , a work permit-and see my mama in philippines after 21yr separation @ twitterid # immigrationaction
astrid silva , who obama name-checked in the speech , was in attendance at the watch party at las vegas ' hermandad mexicana .
carl hulse ( @ hillhulse ) astrid silva , the dreamer mentioned by pres obama , has a close relationship with sen reid , whose view on dream act was influenced by her .
here 's what the president said about silva : tomorrow , i 'll travel to las vegas and meet with some of these students , including a young woman named astrid silva .
astrid was brought to america when she was four years old .
her only possessions were a cross , her doll , and the frilly dress she had on .
when she started school , she did n't speak any english .
she caught up to the other kids by reading newspapers and watching pbs , and became a good student .
her father worked in landscaping .
her mother cleaned other people 's homes .
they would n't let astrid apply to a technology magnet school for fear the paperwork would out her as an undocumented immigrant so she applied behind their back and got in .

still , she mostly lived in the shadows until her grandmother , who visited every year from mexico , passed away , and she could n't travel to the funeral without risk of being found out and deported .
it was around that time she decided to begin advocating for herself and others like her , and today , astrid silva is a college student working on her third degree .
rory carroll ( @ rorycarroll72 ) astrid : 'my family no longer has to live in fear . '
our correspondent rory carroll ( @ rorycarroll72 ) was at las vegas 's hermandad mexicana , which was hosting a watch party of obama 's speech .
he tweets : obama 's challenge to congress - pass a bill ' - elicits biggest cheer yet .
# immigrationwhoops and cheers when obama appears .
then complete silence , straining to catch every word .
# immigration rory carroll ( @ rorycarroll72 ) full house at las vegas 's hermandad mexicana office for obama 's speech .
# immigration obama 's challenge to congress - pass a bill ' - elicits biggest cheer yet .
# immigration

a patriotic scene outside the white house for the speech ( see from earlier of small protest too ) matthew larotonda ( @ mattlarotonda ) immigration activists in support of executive action from pres .
obama gather outside the wh ahead or his 8:00 speech .
cnn 's miguel marquez watched the speech from queens : miguel marquez ( @ miguelmarquez ) very intense watching of the president 's every word .
here 's reaction from senator john mccain , one of the republicans in last year 's senate gang of eight deal ed o'keefe ( @ edatpost ) .
@ senjohnmccain : `` immigration is an issue that must be debated and decided by the representatives of the people , not by executive fiat . ''
and a paragraph from senator marco rubio , a cuban-american son of immigrants and another member of the gang : we need immigration reform .
but the right way to do it is to first bring illegal immigration under control by securing the borders and enforcing the laws , then modernizing our legal immigration system .
after we do these things , we will eventually have to deal with those here illegally in a reasonable but responsible way .
the president 's actions now make all of this harder and are unfair to people in our immigration system who are doing things the right way .
and the president concludes : that 's the country our parents and grandparents and generations before them built for us .
that 's the tradition we must uphold .
that 's the legacy we must leave for those who are yet to come .
thank you , god bless you , and god bless this country we love .

documents.title: obama : 'we were strangers once , too '
text: obama moves toward the end of his speech with an allusion to scripture .

scripture tells us that we shall not oppress a stranger , for we know the heart of a stranger we were strangers once , too , he says : my fellow americans , we are and always will be a nation of immigrants .
we were strangers once , too .

and whether our forebears were strangers who crossed the atlantic , or the pacific , or the rio grande , we are here only because this country welcomed them in , and taught them that to be an american is about something more than what we look like , or what our last names are , or how we worship .
what makes us americans is our shared commitment to an ideal that all of us are created equal , and all of us have the chance to make of our lives what we will .

in the next passage of his speech , the president gets personal , identifying with the struggles of immigrants who work three jobs without taking a dime from the government and even mentioning his daughters : i know the politics of this issue are tough .
but let me tell you why i have come to feel so strongly about it .

over the past few years , i have seen the determination of immigrant fathers who worked two or three jobs , without taking a dime from the government , and at risk at any moment of losing it all , just to build a better life for their kids .
i 've seen the heartbreak and anxiety of children whose mothers might be taken away from them just because they did n't have the right papers .

i 've seen the courage of students who , except for the circumstances of their birth , are as american as malia or sasha ; students who bravely come out as undocumented in hopes they could make a difference in a country they love .
these people our neighbors , our classmates , our friends they did not come here in search of a free ride or an easy life .
they came to work , and study , and serve in our military , and above all , contribute to america 's success .

the president deploys a series of rhetorical questions to capture what he portrays as the national character , which he says objects to the separation of families and believes in a chance to make amends : are we a nation that tolerates the hypocrisy of a system where workers who our fruit and make our beds never have a chance to get right with the law ?
or are we a nation that gives them a chance to make amends , take responsibility , and give their kids a better future ?
are we a nation that accepts the cruelty of ripping children from their parents ' arms ?
or are we a nation that values families , and works to keep them together ?
are we a nation that educates the world 's best and brightest in our universities , only to send them home to create businesses in countries that compete against us ?
or are we a nation that encourages them to stay and create jobs , businesses , and industries right here in america ?
obama says his actions would not stick it to families who feel like they 've gotten the raw end of the deal : so we do n't like the notion that anyone might get a free pass to american citizenship .

i know that some worry immigration will change the very fabric of who we are , or take our jobs , or stick it to middle-class families at a time when they already feel like they 've gotten the raw end of the deal for over a decade .
i hear these concerns .
but that 's not what these steps would do .
our history and the facts show that immigrants are a net plus for our economy and our society .
and i believe it 's important that all of us have this debate without impugning each other 's character .

documents.title: obama to critics : 'pass a bill '
text: obama says he has one answer for critics who question my authority : pass a bill : the actions i 'm taking are not only lawful , they 're the kinds of actions taken by every single republican president and every single democratic president for the past half century .

and to those members of congress who question my authority to make our immigration system work better , or question the wisdom of me acting where congress has failed , i have one answer : pass a bill .
i want to work with both parties to pass a more permanent legislative solution .
and the day i sign that bill into law , the actions i take will no longer be necessary .
meanwhile , do n't let a disagreement over a single issue be a dealbreaker on every issue .
that 's not how our democracy works , and congress certainly should n't shut down our government again just because we disagree on this .
americans are tired of gridlock .
what our country needs from us right now is a common purpose a higher purpose .
obama says previous presidents all have deferred deportations , going so far as to quote george w. bush : as my predecessor , president bush , once put it : they are a part of american life .
now here 's the thing : we expect people who live in this country to play by the rules .
we expect that those who cut the line will not be unfairly rewarded .

so we 're going to offer the following deal : if you 've been in america for more than five years ; if you have children who are american citizens or legal residents ; if you register , pass a criminal background check , and you 're willing to pay your fair share of taxes you 'll be able to apply to stay in this country temporarily , without fear of deportation .
you can come out of the shadows and get right with the law .
obama says his plan does not grant citizenship : that 's what this deal is .
now let 's be clear about what it is n't .
this deal does not apply to anyone who has come to this country recently .
it does not apply to anyone who might come to america illegally in the future .
it does not grant citizenship , or the right to stay here permanently , or offer the same benefits that citizens receive only congress can do that .
all we 're saying is we 're not going to deport you .

documents.title: obama outlines 3 areas of action on immigration
text: the president turns to actions he 's taking in three areas : now , i continue to believe that the best way to solve this problem is by working together to pass that kind of common sense law .

but until that happens , there are actions i have the legal authority to take as president the same kinds of actions taken by democratic and republican presidents before me that will help make our immigration system more fair and more just .
tonight , i am announcing those actions .

first , we 'll build on our progress at the border with additional resources for our law enforcement personnel so that they can stem the flow of illegal crossings , and speed the return of those who do cross over .
second , i will make it easier and faster for high-skilled immigrants , graduates , and entrepreneurs to stay and contribute to our economy , as so many business leaders have proposed .
third , we 'll take steps to deal responsibly with the millions of undocumented immigrants who already live in our country .
obama says the immigration problem is frustrating on all sides .
it 's been this way for decades , he says .
and for decades , we have n't done much about it .
families who enter our country the right way and play by the rules watch others flout the rules .
business owners who offer their workers good wages and benefits see the competition exploit undocumented immigrants by paying them far less .
all of us take offense to anyone who reaps the rewards of living in america without taking on the responsibilities of living in america .
and undocumented immigrants who desperately want to embrace those responsibilities see little option but to remain in the shadows , or risk their families being torn apart .
it 's been this way for decades .
and for decades , we have n't done much about it .
when i took office , i committed to fixing this broken immigration system .
and i began by doing what i could to secure our borders .
today , we have more agents and technology deployed to secure our southern border than at any time in our history .
and over the past six years , illegal border crossings have been cut by more than half .
although this summer , there was a brief spike in unaccompanied children being apprehended at our border , the number of such children is now actually lower than it 's been in nearly two years .
overall , the number of people trying to cross our border illegally is at its lowest level since the 1970s .
those are the facts .
and the president begins speaking .

he starts with a rhetorical flourish , paying warm tribute to the youthful , dynamic , and entrepreneurial spirit he says immigrants bring to the country : my fellow americans , tonight , i 'd like to talk with you about immigration .
for more than 200 years , our tradition of welcoming immigrants from around the world has given us a tremendous advantage over other nations .
it 's kept us youthful , dynamic , and entrepreneurial .
it has shaped our character as a people with limitless possibilities people not trapped by our past , but able to remake ourselves as we choose .
but today , our immigration system is broken , and everybody knows it
some protesters have gathered outside the white house .
abc news politics ( @ abcpolitics ) live : people gather outside the white house ahead of pres .
obama 's speech on immigration :

documents.title: obama immigration speech : live stream
text: about ten minutes until the president 's speech .
you can watch a live stream of the speech on youtube , if you 're not by a tv or if your tv only gets , you know , the english language networks .

as much as migrants are pulled to the united states by the strength of the us economy , family ties and other factors , latino migrants also are pushed north from their home countries by a range of factors including cycles of violence .
a small share of those stories percolate into the american media .

but to two headlines we 've published in the past two days : gang violence in el salvador fuelling country 's child migration crisis i want to go to school but the gangs wo n't let me cross into the neighbourhood , so we decided i should try to reach arkansas , where my mum lives , he said .
i do n't really know my mum because she left me with my grandmother when i was just a few months old to find work , but at least in america it would be safe to go to school .
in the end , reinaldo only made it as far as the southern mexican state of oaxaca , before immigration officials boarded his bus and detained him and several other undocumented migrants .

death of miss honduras and sister shocks nation with worst homicide rate the bodies of a national beauty queen and her sister were found buried by a river in northern honduras on wednesday , shocking the central american nation and highlighting the depth of its long standing security crisis .
marã­a josã© alvarado , 19 , had been due to travel to london on thursday in preparation for the miss world pageant in december .
her body was found alongside that of her 23-year-old sister sofã­a , who worked as a primary school teacher .

in the introduction to this blog we promised you content related to the latin grammy awards , the broadcast of which is being postponed tonight by univision so the spanish-language network can bring viewers the president 's immigration speech live ( no , that timing was not accidental ) .
a lot of people watch univision .
last year , the network finished first among broadcast networks during july sweeps in two highly sought-after demographics : 18- to 49-year-olds and 18- to 34-year-olds , pew reported .
and the latin grammys is a big enough television event that univision had a countdown clock on its web site , which currently is hosting a live broadcast from backstage .
a lot of big awards are up for grabs tonight , but the biggest of all may be record of the year .

nominated this year are dnde estã¡ el amor , by pablo alborã¡n featuring jesse & joy ; cambio de piel , by marc anthony ; respira el momento , by calle 13 ; decidiste dejarme , by camila ; universos paralelos , by jorge drexler featuring ana tijoux ; llegaste tãº , by luis fonsi featuring juan luis guerra ; bailando , by enrique iglesias featuring descemer bueno & gente de zona ; darte un beso , by prince royce ; cuando nos volvamos a encontrar , by carlos vives featuring marc anthony ; and el mar de sus ojos , by carlos vives featuring chocquibtown .
who should win ?
tell us in the comments !
here 's the video for bailando , by enrique iglesias , featuring descemer bueno and gente de zona :

documents.title: olc opinion : anticipated obama actions are 'permissible exercises '
text: we 'd note that the white house is going out of its way to emphasize not to say they 're harping on it the entirely legal nature of tonight 's executive actions .
the second sentence of the fact sheet released earlier begins with a five-word dependent clause : acting within his legal authority .
the white house missive continues : for more than a half century , every presidentdemocratic or republicanhas used his legal authority to act on immigration .
president obama is now taking another commonsense step every democratic and republican president since dwight eisenhower has taken executive action on immigration .

the main store of the administration 's defense of the legality of the presidential actions , however , is an opinion just released from the office of legal counsel ( pdf ) , the preview summary of which reads : for the reasons discussed below , we conclude that dhs 's proposed prioritization policy and its proposed deferred action program for parents of u.s. citizens and lawful permanent residents would be permissible exercises of dhs 's discretion to enforce the immigration laws .
we further conclude that , as it has been described to us , the proposed deferred action program for parents of daca recipients would not be a permissible exercise of enforcement discretion .

it 's notable that this olc opinion finds that deferring action for parents of daca recipients ( kids who are n't citizens or permanent residents ) is not within the enforcement discretion of the department of homeland security .

an immigration reporter captures the intricacy of emerging views on the president 's policy announcement due in about an hour : elise foley ( @ elisefoley ) my inbox is crowded , so please put tyrant in your press release subject line if you 're opposed and hero if you 're supportive .
here 's a sample of the discourse : marshall locke ( @ marshalllocke ) @ hughhewitt : emperor obama , courtesy of @ twitterid

documents.title: boehner : obama acting like an 'emperor '
text: house speaker john boehner has released a video statement pre-reacting to obama 's speech .
he accuses the president of playing king : that 's just not how our democracy works .
the president has said before that he 's not king , and he 's not an emperor , but he 's sure acting like one . '

here 's a cut-and-pastable version of those speech excerpts released by the white house in case you want to share the best lines with your friends : that 's the real amnesty leaving this broken system the way it is .
mass amnesty would be unfair .
mass deportation would be both impossible and contrary to our character .
what i 'm describing is accountability a commonsense , middle ground approach : if you meet the criteria , you can come out of the shadows and get right with the law .
if you 're a criminal , you 'll be deported .
if you plan to enter the u.s. illegally , your chances of getting caught and sent back just went up .
the actions i 'm taking are not only lawful , they 're the kinds of actions taken by every single republican president and every democratic president for the past half century .

and to those members of congress who question my authority to make our immigration system work better , or question the wisdom of me acting where congress has failed , i have one answer : pass a bill .

as we wait for the president to speak , here 's a summary of where things stand : the white house has announced major features of president obama 's executive actions on immigration to be outlined in a primetime address tonight .
five million undocumented migrants will benefit from the actions , according to the white house count .
the president will announce new protections against deportation for parents of children who are us citizens or legal permanent residents , the white house said .
obama was also to expand the pool of undocumented migrants protected under the deferred action for childhood arrivals program ( daca ) .
according to advance excerpts of obama 's speech , he is to reject the notion that his actions represent amnesty .
real amnesty would be leaving this broken system the way it is , the president is expected to say .
the reforms are being packaged as the immigration accountability executive actions .
hundreds of border patrol and immigration agents are being added to the southwest border as part of the plan , the white house said .
the white house has now released excerpts of the president 's speech : zeke miller ( @ zekejmiller ) excerpts of the president 's address to the nation
under the category of increased border security , the white house says it has shifted hundreds of border patrol and ice agents to the southwest border .
it says it will clear a backlog of pending cases from immigration courts , and provide new protections for victims of crime and human trafficking .
obama will also announce a new priority enforcement program to focus on deporting those convicted of criminal offenses , the white house says .

documents.title: obama to defer action for some migrant parents
text: we 're digging down a bit more into the white house description of what the president will announce tonight .
the biggest line may be a new deferred action program for parents of u.s. citizens or legal permanent residents who are not enforcement priorities and have been in the country for more than 5 years .

individuals will have the opportunity to request temporary relief from deportation and work authorization for three years at a time if they come forward and register , submit biometric data , pass background checks , pay fees , and show that their child was born before the date of this announcement .

by providing individuals with an opportunity to come out of the shadows and work legally , we will also help crack down on companies who hired undocumented workers , which undermines the wages of all workers , and ensure that individuals are playing by the rules and paying their fair share of taxes .
the president also plans to expand the deferred action for childhool arrivals program , or daca , to cover additional dreamers .
it would move the current entry cutoff for daca cases by two-and-a-half years and remove the age limit of 30 years old for daca cases .

under the initial daca program , young people who had been in the u.s. for at least five years , came as children , and met specific education and public safety criteria were eligible for temporary relief from deportation so long as they were born after 1981 and entered the country before june 15 , 2007 .
dhs is expanding daca so that individuals who were brought to this country as children can apply if they entered before january 1 , 2010 , regardless of how old they are today .
going forward , daca relief will also be granted for three years .
here are three critical elements of the president 's executive actions as just announced by the white house .

they are cracking down on illegal immigration at the border , deporting felons , not families and accountability criminal background checks and taxes : â· cracking down on illegal immigration at the border : the president 's actions increase the chances that anyone attempting to cross the border illegally will be caught and sent back .

continuing the surge of resources that effectively reduced the number of unaccompanied children crossing the border illegally this summer , the president 's actions will also centralize border security command-and-control to continue to crack down on illegal immigration .
â· deporting felons , not families : the president 's actions focus on the deportation of people who threaten national security and public safety .
he has directed immigration enforcement to place anyone suspected of terrorism , violent criminals , gang members , and recent border crossers at the top of the deportation priority list .

â· accountability criminal background checks and taxes : the president is also acting to hold accountable those undocumented immigrants who have lived in the us for more than five years and are parents of u.s. citizens or lawful permanent residents .

by registering and passing criminal and national security background checks , millions of undocumented immigrants will start paying their fair share of taxes and temporarily stay in the u.s. without fear of deportation for three years at a time .

documents.title: white house has immigration key word : `` accountable ''
text: the white house has just released an announcement outlining the executive actions obama will describe tonight .
the announcement says five million undocumented immigrants will be affected .
it is careful to portray the action not as offering migrants protection from deportation .
instead it says the white house is holding them accountable .
accountable appears to be the word of the night .
the white house statement refers to the president 's new policies as immigration accountability executive actions .
the announcement asserts consequences from the actions that republicans would be inclined to favor , namely securing the border .
acting within his legal authority , the statement reads , the president is taking an important step to fix our broken immigration system .

documents.title: three secrets about obama 's immigration speech
text: quickly sketched coverage of tonight 's speech has a president filling an heroic role to immigration activists as republicans stand outside the white house gnashing their teeth and promising revenge .

in fact many immigration activists are deeply ambiguous about obama 's record on the issue and a lot of members of congress republican and democrat have already left washington for a long thanksgiving break .

here are three secrets about obama 's immigration speech tonight : 1 ) to many activists , obama is no hero on immigration obama has increased deportations , even as arrivals have decreased with the weakening in the last eight years of the economic magnet that is the united states .

the president has initiated more than 225,000 deportation proceedings annually 11,000 more than his republican predecessor , george w. bush , writes david rogers in politico : moreover , obama has done this from a smaller pool as border crossings have dropped significantly from the early levels under bush .

recent estimates by the pew research center indicate that the population of undocumented immigrants in the united states has been relatively stable at about 11.3 million down by about 1 million from its peak before the great recession , which obama inherited after the 2008 election .

2 ) congress may not be able to defund obama 's executive actions to block obama 's new executive actions , republicans have promised everything from impeachment proceedings to risking a new government shutdown .
incoming senate leader mitch mcconnell has said republicans would use budget measures to defund the president 's latest initiatives .
the twist is that that might not be possible .

the house appropriations committee has released a statement to the new york times explaining why , in its view , it could not deny funding to the agency responsible for carrying out executive action on immigration : the primary agency for implementing the president 's new immigration executive order is the u.s .
citizenship and immigration services ( uscis ) .
this agency is entirely self-funded through the fees it collects on various immigration applications .
congress does not appropriate funds for any of its operations , including the issuance of immigration status or work permits , with the exception of the e-verify ' program .
therefore , the appropriations process can not be used to defund the agency .

the agency has the ability to continue to collect and use fees to continue current operations , and to expand operations as under a new executive order , without needing legislative approval by the appropriations committee or the congress , even under a continuing resolution or a government shutdown .
3 ) washington is empty and the 113th congress is running out of time a long thanksgiving recess begins tomorrow , and many legislators have left washington already or are on their way home .
the hill notes that legislators will have precious little time after they come back from break to pass a continuing budget resolution , much less reverse the president 's immigration platform .
current legislation to fund the government expires on 11 december , setting up a natural deadline for a policy fight or , some pessimists say , another government shutdown .

documents.title: why the networks are not carrying obama 's big speech
text: as befits a major presidential policy speech ( ) , none of the four major us television networks plans to broadcast tonight 's address .
it will still be easy to catch obama on tv .
cnn , msnbc , univision , telemundo and others all plan to carry the address live .
univision even accepted to delay its broadcast of the latin grammy awards in order to bring the president to its audience .
more on the latin grammys in a moment .
but first , why are n't the nets carrying obama ?
someone from the nets whispered anonymously to politico that tonight 's speech was just too overtly political to carry .
the guardian 's nicky woolf reports entertainingly here on several more plausible explanations , including the fact that thursdays are big nights for the networks .
consider what viewers would be missing if they watch barack obama talk live tonight about border security and deferring deportations that could keep millions of families together .
abc : grey 's anatomy : winter finale a disagreement about a patient 's case leads to a bigger argument between meredith and derek .
nbc : the biggest loser : no i ' in team if the players can cumulatively lose 50 pounds , no one goes home this week !
cbs : the big bang theory : champagne reflection sheldon says a tearful goodbye to fun with flags .
also , leonard , howard and raj look for something significant oh forget it read the rest here .
fox : bones : the puzzler in the pit the team investigates the murder of a crossword puzzle master for those not signed up for any of the above , obama 's speech is scheduled to begin at 8pm et .
we 'll embed it atop the blog when the time is ripe .
mark knoller ( @ markknoller ) tomorrow 's speech will be 11th address to the nation by pres obama ; 5th time from the east room .
only twice from the oval office .
guardian washington bureau chief dan roberts ( @ danroberts ) sends this montage of speeches by immigration reform activists who gathered at the national press club on thursday .
they hail a grand success and a great day for america .
senator ted cruz of texas , one of the most reliable critics of the president and one of the legislature 's most colorful rhetoricians , has pulled out all the stops for the current debate .
cruz has gone the full cicero , guardian washington correspondent paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) reports .
cruz invoked the roman philosopher in a senate floor speech accusing obama of wanting to destroy the constitution : when , president obama , do you mean to cease abusing our patience ?
cruz declared in a speech modelled on cicero 's first oration against catiline to the roman senate .
how long is that madness of yours still to mock us ?
when is there to be an end to that unbridled audacity of yours swaggering about as it does now ?

unfortunately for cruz , reports paul , the senator 's allusion actually serves to undermine the point he sought to make : paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) face-palm moment as ted cruz uses the wrong cicero speech :

documents.title: is obama breaking the law ?
text: as with previous executive action he has taken on health care and immigration , president barack obama stands accused , with tonight 's announcement , of arrogating power to the executive not allotted in the constitution .
some of these arguments are more insinuated than others .
ben white ( @ morningmoneyben ) predictable .
but still pretty amusing .
the argument warrants a look from both sides .
on the side arguing that tonight 's executive action may be illegal , interestingly , we have barack obama himself , speaking on telemundo in september 2013 .
he was asked whether he would at least consider unilaterally freezing the deportations for parents of deferred-action kids .
obama answered that he had authority as the executive to protect childhood arrivals .
but if we start broadening that , then essentially i would be ignoring the law in a way that i think would be very difficult to defend legally , he said .
so that 's not an option .
noam scheiber ( @ noamscheiber ) 1 thing i blame obama for : telling immig reformers he does n't think he 's got authority to act alone .
never good to bullshit yr own folks .

the white house strikes no such tone of reservation in defending the actions to be announced tonight , noting that presidents going back to ronald reagan all have taken executive action to defer deportation for certain groups of immigrants , and arguing that the courts have upheld such actions .
administration officials cite , in particular , the supreme court 's ruling in a 2012 case rejecting key provisions in a new arizona anti-illegal immigration law , writes josh gerstein in politico .
that decision described broad discretion exercised by immigration officials as a principal feature of the deportation system .
some analysts associated with the left argue that while the actions may be legal , they may not be wise , for the precedent they set .
one widely discussed contribution on this theme is jonathan chait 's obama 's immigration plan should scare liberals , too , which says in part : i fully support obama 's immigration policy goals .
but the defenses of obama 's methods seem weak and short-sighted .

to imagine how this method might be dangerous , you have to abstract it away from the specific end it advances and consider another administration using similar methods for policies liberals might not like .
what if a republican president announced that he would stop enforcing the payment of estate taxes ?
or suspend enforcement of regulations on industrial pollution ?
or laws on workplace discrimination against gays and lesbians ?
proof that these speeches do n't write themselves : petesouza ( @ petesouza ) president obama works on tomorrow night 's immigration speech w cody keenan and david litt
immigrants take oath of citizenship to the united states on november 20 , 2014 in newark , new jersey .
sixty immigrants from 25 countries became american citizens during the naturalization ceremony at the u.s. immigration and citizenship services ( uscis ) office at newark 's federal building .
moore/getty images

writing in comment is free , gustavo bonilla , an immigrant from honduras who is facing deportation on new year 's eve , explains how tonight 's action may not go far enough for my family : but when hurricane katrina hit new orleans nine years ago , it did so much damage to my home i would 've become homeless if my friend had n't offered his apartment as a temporary refuge .
but my friend had n't told me that his landlord had banned subletters , housemates or long-term guests and , instead of asking me to leave , the landlord called the police .
i was arrested and , even though the charges were dropped , i was turned over to ice for deportation .
but i had my life here my beautiful baby girl was only a few months old and i faced only threats and unemployment in honduras .
so i became what ice calls a repeat offender and returned to the life i had established for myself , to be part of helping the city i had come to love recover from the storm .

as a parent of a us citizen , bonilla may stand to gain protection from the actions to be announced tonight , but with multiple arrests and a date set for his deportation , he worries that he may be separated from his family .
read the full piece here .
what protections are the executive actions announced tonight not expected to encompass ?
tonight 's announcement is expected to affect roughly half of the 11-12 million immigrants in the united states without legal status .
the beneficiaries will receive temporary protection against deportation and will be able to apply for work permits ( if the advance reports are accurate ) .
but the executive actions are expected to leave out significant groups of immigrants and to stop short of extending certain protections to immigrants who do benefit .
obama 's actions would not , for example , award immigrants a green card or give them a path to citizenship .
neither would they make subsidies for health care that americans now receive under the affordable care act available to immigrants .

while obama 's actions are expected to extend protection to parents of children who are us citizens or legal residents , the actions are not expected to protect parents of children who benefit from the deferred action on childhood arrivals program announced by obama in 2012 .

since that program is based on executive action by obama , julia preston explains in the new york times , the youths have deportation deferrals and work permits but no green cards or any other visa or formal immigration status , which only congress can confer .
their parents ' claim for relief is weaker , the officials said .
obama 's actions to be announced tonight likewise are not expected to protect farm workers , a group whose cause has been advanced by some business groups who otherwise are not pro-immigration .

open questions include how much the president will expand the daca program , which currently does not cover immigrants over the age of 30 , and whether the president will encourage new immigration of high-tech workers .
many other details of his plan , including additional border security measures , are as yet unknown .

documents.title: where the number five million comes from
text: based on what we know about the executive actions the president is prepared to announce tonight , most reports are saying that about five million immigrants in the united states stand to gain protection from deportation .
on the guardian data blog , alberto nardelli and george arnett have broken down where that number comes from .
for a further explanation of the numbers in the graphic , click here .
on poison , matches , matadors , and hand grenades .

choose your metaphor : after carpet-bombing democrats in the midterm elections , republicans fought like roosters to come up with the best analogy for what it would be like if president barack obama took unilateral executive action on immigration reform .
none contributed an especially original entry , but then they 're paid to legislate , not wax poetic .
or to legislate .
who do you think said it best ?

house speaker john boehner : poison the well and play with matches : i 've made clear to the president that if he acts unilaterally , on his own , outside of his authority , he will poison the well , and there will be no chance of immigration reform moving in this congress .
it is as simple as that , he said .
when you play with matches , you take the risk of burning yourself .
and he 's going to burn himself if he continues to go down this path .

incoming senate majority leader mitch mcconnell : red flag in front of a bull and poison the well : i think the president choosing to do a lot of things unilaterally on immigration would be a big mistake .
it 's an issue that most of my members want to address , legislatively .
and it 's like waving a red flag in front of a bull to say i will do it on my own .
i hope he wo n't do that because i do i think it poisons the well for the opportunity to address a very important domestic issue .
senator john barrasso of wyoming and representative mario diaz-balart , republican of florida : hand grenade if this analogy is voted best , two congressman will have to split the honors .
barrasso said unilateral action on immigration would be like pulling the pin out of a hand grenade .
diaz-balart said , it would be like pulling the pin off a hand grenade and tossing it into the middle of the room .

documents.title: timeline : obama on immigration
text: here 's a brief history of immigration reform during the candidacy and presidency of barack obama : 2008 the presidential run .

in a may appearance in denver , colorado , which has an electorally significant latino population , candidate barack obama tells univision host jorge ramos , i can guarantee that we will have , in the first year , an immigration bill that i strongly support .
november : obama is elected president with 67 % of the hispanic vote and 62 % of the asian vote , according to exit polls .
2009 june : after a half-year of work on an economic stimulus plan , unemployment insurance , an auto bailout and more , the obama administration lumbers to life on immigration .
his position is very clear : he thinks we need comprehensive immigration reform , david axelrod , then senior adviser , told the new york times in an interview .
but that 's not something that 's going to happen simply on his volition .
congress does n't bite .
2010 january : obama devotes a couple paragraphs of his state of the union address to immigration reform .

we should continue the work of fixing our broken immigration system to secure our borders and enforce our laws , and ensure that everyone who plays by the rules can contribute to our economy and enrich our nation , he says .
in the end , it 's our ideals , our values that built america values that allowed us to forge a nation made up of immigrants from every corner of the globe ; values that drive our citizens still .

december : the dream act , which would have extended protection against deportation to children of undocumented immigrants , falls short in the senate by a vote of 55-41 , after having passed the house .
a disappointment for activists who had worked for the legislation since 2001 , when it was first introduced in the senate .
the bill had been voted down in a previous outing in 2007 .
2011 may : the white house releases a blueprint for building a 21st century immigration system .
we must finish the work congress started last year , and pass the dream act , the document says .
we must respect families following the rules reuniting them instead of splitting them apart .
and , we need to provide farmers a legal way to hire workers and a path for those workers to earn legal status .
2012 june : in a major policy intervention , obama orders immigration enforcement agents to defer action against young people who had arrived to the united states as children .
the move , known as deferred action for childhood arrivals , is estimated to affect 580,000 immigrants .
it offers a path to work permits .
some reform advocates criticize the move for not doing more to protect families and not protecting more young immigrants .
november : obama is reelected president , this time with 71 % of the hispanic vote and 73 % of the asian vote , according to exit polls .
obama demolishes former massachusetts governor mitt romney among hispanic and latino voters by more than 40 points .
november : house speaker john boehner tells abc news that immigration ought to be dealt with .
it 's an important issue that i think ought to be dealt with , he says .
this issue has been around far too long .

while i believe it 's important for us to secure our borders and to enforce our laws , i think a comprehensive approach is long overdue , and i 'm confident that the president , myself , others , can find the common ground to take care of this issue once and for all .
2013 january : obama advances new principles for immigration reform in a speech at del sol high school in las vegas .
the principles are in line with a plan being crafted in the senate by a bipartisan gang of eight senators .
june : the senate passes the gang of eight 's immigration reform bill 68-32 .
the bill contained a path to citizenship over 13 years for undocumented workers and some $ 40bn for border security .
the house would never vote on it .

november : a year after he said immigration reform ought to be dealt with , house speaker john boehner says he will not convene a conference to reconcile potential house legislation with the bill that passed the senate .
legislative action stalls .
2014 january : house republicans come back from a caucus retreat and release immigration principles .
the principles do not allow for a path to citizenship , as did the gang of eight legislation that passed the senate .
4 november : republicans take the senate in midterm elections and expand their majority in the house .
incoming senate majority leader mitch mcconnell warns obama not to take unilateral action on immigration , saying that would be like waving a red flag in front of a bull .
19 november : obama plans a primetime speech to announce major new executive actions on immigration reform .
good afternoon and welcome to our live blog coverage of an announcement by barack obama of major changes to us immigration policy .

in a primetime tv address from the white house this evening , the president is expected to describe new executive actions that would remove the immediate threat of deportation for millions of immigrants living in the united states without residency documents .

the speech is a culmination of six years of struggle between a president who has made big promises about reform and congresses that have gone from cold to hot and back about rewriting immigration laws .
critics of the president say his apparent decision to act unilaterally on the issue amounts to a gross usurpation of power .
reform advocates are saying something more along the lines of : finally .

according to details dished to the press , the executive actions obama is set to announce tonight could affect around five million immigrants , from two main groups : families of children who are citizens or legal residents of the us , and young people who came to the country as children .
the president took action to protect an estimated 580,000 members of the latter group in his first big order on immigration back in june 2012 .
hours before the speech is to begin , republicans in congress already are attacking it .
the president will come to regret the chapter history writes if he does move forward , incoming majority leader mitch mcconnell said in a speech on the senate floor on thursday .
when the newly elected representatives of the people take their seats , they will act .
there 's a lot more where that came from .

this blog will round up the most trenchant observations from both sides of the aisle , consider the constitutionality of what is happening , look back at obama 's immigration record so far and , importantly , handicap the latin grammys .
for now we leave you with this preview of tonight 's speech from the man himself , employing the traditional single-butt-cheek-on-the-resolute-desk stance for notices of impending executive actions :
